turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Capture of Gueudecourt.
turn.1: What happened at the capture of Gueudecourt?
turn.2: About of the trench was still occupied by the Germans and the tank drove up Pilgrim's Way at firing into Gird Trench, followed by bombers of the 7th Leicester and two infantry companies, which bombed the German defenders south-eastwards towards the Guards Division.
turn.3: Did this capture a lot of Germans?
turn.4: German troops who ran back in the open were shot down and those who sheltered in bunkers were bombed out.
turn.6: An artillery-observation aircrew from 3 Squadron overhead, saw that the Germans had been forced into a length of the trench.
turn.7: Did they eventually get forced into a corner?
turn.8: The observer pinpointed the ends and sent a zone call, after which the trench was severely bombarded; after a few minutes the crew directed the artillery to cease fire and strafed the trench with machine-gun fire from , after which mainly from Reserve Infantry Regiment 238 of the 52nd Reserve Division, surrendered.
turn.9: Did the British take them prisoner?
turn.10: The crew dropped a message to the infantry, who took the prisoners, having had five casualties.
turn.12: The 15th DLI advanced from the front of the 64th Brigade and occupied the Gird Trenches and after receiving reports from the Welsh Guards that they could walk in the open unmolested, the XV Corps headquarters ordered patrols into Gueudecourt and at sent patrols of Cavalry Corps and the South Irish Horse, the corps cavalry regiment, to reconnoitre higher ground to the north-east and north-west.
